ASK

posts.body:
On This Day In History

November 21st, 1920: “Bloody Sunday” during the Irish War of Independence. Members of the Irish Republican Army (IRA) assassinate a number of British intelligence officers. In total, they killed or wounded 15 people, including at least two civilians.

In response, British forces raided a Gaelic football match in order to cordon and search it; without warning they opened fire. 14 civilians, including two children, were killed and at least 20 more were wounded.

A total of five Irishmen (four IRA members and one civilian) would be killed in response to this: two IRA members and the civilians were captured, beaten, and shot that same day, two IRA members were hanged the next year.

reblog.comment:
On This Day In History

In response, British forces raided a Gaelic football match in order to cordon and search it; without warning they opened fire. 14 civilians, including two children, were killed and at least 20 more were wounded.

A total of five Irishmen (four IRA members and one civilian) would be killed in response to this: two IRA members and the civilians were captured, beaten, and shot that same day, two IRA members were hanged the next year.

posts.body:
On This Day In History

November 15th, 1985: The Anglo-Irish Agreement is signed by Prime Minister Thatcher and Taoiseach FitzGerald. It ultimately failed to unite the people of Northern Ireland or bring an end to the political violence there, and was opposed on both sides, but is seen as a key stepping stone for eventual peace.

posts.summary: ‼️PLEASE HELP HOMELESS FILIPINO SIBLINGS AFFORD A HOME‼️
posts.body:
creepinginyourheartbabecomeonnow:

‼️PLEASE HELP HOMELESS FILIPINO SIBLINGS AFFORD A HOME‼️

Hi, im alex. We’re a Filipino siblings of 4 and im the eldest. We lost our dad to heart failure and our mom to cardiac arrest just three and two months ago

We’re still homeless and staying at motels is getting more expensive and not all are willing to take us in because of our dirty appearance

I found this place for rent at $121 (pictures sent by the landlord) but he’s asking for 1 month advance, 2 months deposit from us to move in. He’s kind enough to let us rent without IDs and a contract but we dont have $363 at the moment to move in

We’re currently staying at a street near this place, we’d really like to move in

If 20 people can each spare us $18, we can move in soon. we’d be forever grateful. please reblog this post as well, it goes a long way

Pay Alexandria Mangahas using PayPal.Me

I would also like to thank everyone who generously donated and reblogged my posts last time, we were able to buy food, medicines and motels for a week all because of you all, we’re very grateful and you are all in our prayers

I sent you some back on the 12th, but it doesn’t look like you got it and it has not been deducted from my account. Should I keep waiting, cancel and try again?

reblog.comment: I sent you some back on the 12th, but it doesn’t look like you got it and it has not been deducted from my account. Should I keep waiting, cancel and try again?

On This Day In History

November 7th, 1919: The first Palmer Raid occurs in the United States by the US Department of Justice. These raids focused on recent immigrants, leftists, Italians, and Jewish people. Over 3,000 suspected communists, socialists, and anarchists are arrested and over 500 people were deported.

ASK

posts.summary:
October 30th just made more history for Brazil! 
Soon ex-president Jair Bolsonaro is the first president of Brazil to run for...
posts.question:
October 30th just made more history for Brazil!

Soon ex-president Jair Bolsonaro is the first president of Brazil to run for presidency again and not get reelected

Luiz Inacio "Lula" da Silva will now be president for the third time, and surpassed his own record of votes

This was the election with the most number of voters, despite the fact road police actively tried to stop people from going

And finally, the state of Rio Grande do Sul reelected its first governor, and he's an openly gay man
posts.answer:
Congratulations Brazil!

Lula is a trade unionist who previously served as president of Brazil from 2003 to 2010. He was one of the most popular politicians in Brazilian history due to his leftist policies, but his administration was plague by corruption scandals and he spent 580 days in prison as a result until the incarceration was ruled unlawful.

Jair Bolsonaro is a politician and military man who runs on a conservative ticket. A Christian who runs on “family values”, he has been heavily criticized for his views on social issues. Political scholars find him authoritarian and very close to fascist.

This election is the first time a Brazilian president has lost re-election in thirty years.

reblog.comment:
Congratulations Brazil!

Jair Bolsonaro is a politician and military man who runs on a conservative ticket. A Christian who runs on “family values”, he has been heavily criticized for his views on social issues. Political scholars find him authoritarian and very close to fascist.

This election is the first time a Brazilian president has lost re-election in thirty years.

Jair Bolsonaro is a politician and military man who runs on a conservative ticket. A Christian who runs on “family values”, he has been heavily criticized for his views on social issues. Political scholars find him authoritarian and very close to fascist.

This election is the first time a Brazilian president has lost re-election in thirty years.

He was one of the most popular politicians in Brazilian history due to his leftist policies, but his administration was plague by corruption scandals and he spent 580 days in prison as a result until the incarceration was ruled unlawful.

Jair Bolsonaro is a politician and military man who runs on a conservative ticket. A Christian who runs on “family values”, he has been heavily criticized for his views on social issues. Political scholars find him authoritarian and very close to fascist.

ASK

posts.body:
On This Day In History

October 28th, 1922: Benito Mussolini, leading the National Fascist Party of Italy, marches on Rome and seizes power.

Thought Mussolini was eventually killed, his ideology and his family continued to have significant power in Italy. His brother, two of his graddaughters, and his great-grandson have all been far-right Italian political figures. Giorgia Meloni, the current Prime Minister of Italy, is a neo-fascist.
